title: Define Project Scope and Requirements (Revised)
description: This RFC aims to gather and document detailed project requirements for SecureDataSandbox. The scope includes: security considerations such as threat modeling, security controls, performance goals including response times, scalability needs, integration with existing systems including APIs and data formats, potential data handling restrictions due to privacy or regulatory concerns, a roadmap for phased deployment and iterative improvements that prioritize quick wins and addresses long-term vision. The task will also create use cases and user stories for a comprehensive understanding of project requirements, emphasizing clarity and conciseness. This revised draft is now ready for review from the assigned code-architect.

title: Design System Architecture for SecureDataSandbox
description: Design the overall architecture of the secure data sandbox, including components, communication protocols (e.g., gRPC or another secure RESTful API for internal and external communications), security mechanisms (such as encryption using AES-256-GCM, access control, and authentication), data flow, isolation strategies (e.g., virtualization or containerization technologies like Docker). Optimize for scalability, high availability, and fault tolerance. Define monitoring and logging mechanisms for security auditing, incident response, and performance tuning. Ensure secure file transfer protocols are used for both internal and external data transfers, considering SFTP or similar standards. Implement rate limiting and load balancing to protect against DDoS attacks. For added protection, consider implementing TLS/SSL certificates and two-factor authentication. Document the architecture design in the project's technical documentation, detailing each component's responsibilities, data flow diagrams, and security controls. Include a discussion of the chosen technologies' strengths and potential vulnerabilities. Discuss strategies for ensuring the system remains up-to-date with security patches and best practices. Update the project scope and requirements document based on this architecture design. Suggest using Kubernetes for container orchestration, as it offers robustness in managing containers and their resources.

title: Implement Sandbox Environment
description: Develop the core sandbox environment, including virtualization, isolation, and resource management.

title: Develop Security Mechanisms
description: Implement security mechanisms for the sandbox, such as access controls, data sanitization, and malware detection.

title: Build User Interface
description: Design and develop the user interface for interacting with the secure data sandbox, including file upload, analysis initiation, and result visualization.

title: Implement Data Storage and Management
description: Design and develop the data storage and management system for the sandbox, including secure storage of files, analysis results, and audit logs.

title: Set up CI/CD Pipeline
description: Establish a continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline for the project, including automated testing, build, and deployment processes.

title: Develop Test Suite
description: Create a comprehensive test suite for the secure data sandbox, covering unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests.

title: Conduct Security Audits
description: Perform regular security audits on the secure data sandbox to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities.

title: Write Documentation
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the secure data sandbox, including user guides, technical documentation, and deployment instructions.
